intro: Lesquerella engelmannii, commonly known as Engelmann's lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has alternate, pinnately compound leaves. It is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh conditions. Lesquerella engelmannii is also noted for its ability to produce a unique seed oil, which has potential industrial applications.
